page.title: 04WILD ANIMALS AND BIRDS
page.content:
There is an abundance of wild animals in the area, the most profuse being rabbits. Foxes from time to time disturb the flocks. There are several known badger setts and there has been trouble with badger hunters from the cities, although, at the moment, the setts appear to be undisturbed. A few otters survive, although not in the numbers of a few years ago. Stoats and weasels inhabit the areas along the dry-stone walls.
Chaffinches are perhaps the most common of the many species of smaller birds. Curlews inhabit the higher ground and their distinctive cry haunts the fells. Heron and oyster-catchers are frequently seen on the Ure and its tributaries.
